other_tests.findings: Evidence from electromyograms indicated a diagnosis of a slowly progressive, probably hereditary, demyelinating neuropathy likely representing one of the Charcot-Marie-Tooth variants.
Stabilized some sensations of weakness and paresthesias in his hands but did not return function to normal.

Marked atrophy of intrinsic muscles in hands, claw deformities of fourth and fifth fingers bilaterally, moderate muscular atrophy, diminished perception of vibration, pin prick, and temperature below knees; absent deep tendon reflexes in lower extremities.
